basic_info.name: Kate Huang
basic_info.description: I'm Kate, a student at the University of British Columbia (expected graduation May 2024). I'm currently studying Computer Science! In addition to my courses, I work on full-stack web projects in my spare time to supplement my learning in software development. I've had one previous full-stack development co-op and have been a teaching assistant for two undergrad courses at UBC. Before entering the computer science program, I studied engineering physics and was on two robotics design teams. In my spare time, I like to play piano, play with my dog, and draw.

education.brief: Currently in computer science with year 2 standing.

I was in Engineering Physics, an intensive program combining mechanical, electrical, and computer engineering, as well as math and physics. Though it was an enriching experience, I eventually decided that software was my passion and transferred to Computer Science. Awards include Dean's Honours List and Trek Scholarship (awarded to top 5% of undergraduate students).

projects.name: Name and Shame
projects.brief: Hackathon project for Hack the North 2021
projects.body:
A review website for companies geared towards rating their ethical practices. This includes their carbon footprint, stance on human rights, work culture, etc.

This project was orchestrated locally with Docker, which allowed us develop across all our devices without any local development incompatibilities, create a local MongoDB database with ease, and run our project with a single Docker command!

This project was built using a MERN stack.

projects.name: ENPH 253 Robot
projects.brief: Project made for ENPH 253, the robot competition course in Engineering Physics
projects.body:
A can-collecting robot made completely from scratch! We constructed the robot using mainly coroplast and some 3D printed parts. Some examples of what we learned include building H-bridges, integrating sensors, and managing power supplies, and using a BluePill microcontroller.

My role on this project was to design the robot's tape-following logic and overall software integration. Tape-following was implemented with IR sensors, op-amps, and a PID algorithm.

projects.name: Blogmedia
projects.brief: Personal project I made to learn full-stack development with React, Django, and Docker
projects.body:
The intended product is a simple blogging website similar to Tumblr or Twitter. The project is structured as a React SPA and a Django backend which interacts with the frontend using REST APIs. The backend is mainly basic CRUD operations on a PostgreSQL database (using Django's built-in database interface).

The entire project is orchestrated with Docker, including the frontend, backend, and database!

projects.name: Women In Stem
projects.body: A fun REST API for learning about women's accomplishments in STEM! Our vision was that this API would be similar to APIs like a history API. We collected data about various female scientists and engineers and stored them in Firebase, served the API with Flask (which interacted with our Firebase database using CRUD operations), and built a React frontend to show off our API!

projects.name: SaveE
projects.body: An app designed to motivate people to conserve their energy usage using a gamified competition system between users of the app on local, national, and global levels. Built using the Django framework with statically served HTML pages.

experience.summary: I have had one previous co-op doing full-stack development at Loblaw Digital and have been a teaching assistant for one computer science course and one math course. This summer, I'm excited to say that I'll be joining Twitter as a SWE intern!

jobs.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant - APSC 160
jobs.brief: Teaching assistant for intro to C course for engineering students
jobs.description: Assisted with students' understanding of worksheets in lecture and also did marking of labs and exams.

jobs.title: Software Developer Co-op
jobs.description: I was a software development co-op on the Seller Portal team, which built and maintained the platform for third-party sellers on Loblaw Marketplace to manage their orders and products on the website. I was involved with full-stack development, unit testing, and UAT! Some highlights of my time there include rewriting graphics that summarize aggregrated data about user and store growth for our site admins, expanding our use of Canada Post's shipping label APIs so that sellers can more effectively manage their orders with Canada Post, and tons of bug-catching (and fixing!).

jobs.title: Software Team Member
jobs.brief: Worked on the software team at UBC UAS, a design team engineering small unmanned aircraft/drones.
jobs.description: My accomplishments include improving the UI for our ground-based controller (written in React) and writing documentation for development and usage of one of UAS's aircraft's on-board software.

jobs.title: Software Team Member
jobs.brief: Worked on the software team at UBC Snowbots, a design team building autonomous robots for the Canadian Internation Rover Challenge.
jobs.description: I completed the onboarding challenge, which was to write a full ROS program with the goal of steering a robot toward a hole in a wall of cones, which is sensed using a LiDAR scanner. This included understanding concepts such as the publish-subscribe pattern and handling C++ data types and memory.

courses.title: Basic Algorithms and Data Structures
courses.brief: Design and analysis of algorithms and data structures

courses.title: Introduction to Computer Systems
courses.brief: Assembly, memory, control flows, procedures and stack, I/O devices, asynchrony, synchronization

courses.title: Software Construction I
courses.brief: An introduction to practices in software engineering. OOP, unit testing, abstraction and specifications

courses.title: Introduction to Instrument Design
courses.brief: Engineering Physics's summer robot competition for second years

courses.title: Experimental Techniques
courses.brief: Lab course learning how to construct electrical circuits. Analog-digital conversion, op-amps
